thread.section_title: Reuters: Financial Services and Real Estate
thread.title: British property firm Intu posts higher NAV in 2017

title: British property firm Intu posts higher NAV in 2017
text: 51 AM / Updated 19 minutes ago British property firm Intu posts higher NAV in 2017 Reuters Staff 1 Min Read Feb 22 (Reuters) - British shopping centre landlord Intu Properties Plc reported a small rise in full-year NAV, helped by strong tenant demand. The owner of popular shopping malls such as Manchesterâ€™s Trafford centre said adjusted diluted net asset value per share (NAV) rose to 411 pence for the year ended Dec. 31, from 404 pence a year ago. The company, which agreed to be bought by rival British shopping centres owner Hammerson Plc for about 3.4 billion pounds ($4.56 billion) in December, said full-year like-for-like net rental income grew 0.5 percent. (Reporting by Justin George Varghese and Radhika Rukmangadhan in Bengaluru; Editing by Gopakumar Warrier)
